intro: Calonyction galeottii, commonly known as the white sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Calonyction galeottii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas, where it thrives in full sun.
